THE CULTURAL IMPACT OF SYNC The idea of combining licensed songs with the most popular movies, shows, and commercials is not a new phenomenon. Music was a major piece of visual media before anyone was even speaking on video or film. The use of popular artists or songs to illicit emotion or bring attention to a project has been happening for decades. #search #discovery #movies #television #music #tvmusic #filmmusic #socialmedia https://lnkd.in/erjrYCYX

"Dive into the eerie depths of 'Something Strange,' a haunting composition that sends shivers down the spine and whispers secrets from the shadows. With its chilling melodies and mysterious harmonies, this captivating piece of music transports listeners to a realm where the line between reality and the unknown blurs into darkness. From the first haunting notes to the final crescendo, 'Something Strange' immerses you in a world of uncertainty and foreboding. Its atmospheric soundscape conjures images of fog-shrouded landscapes, abandoned corridors, and whispered secrets echoing through the night. As the music unfolds, a sense of unease creeps in, mingling with a curiosity that compels you to venture deeper into the unknown. Each haunting chord and unsettling motif draws you further into the labyrinth of the mind, where mysteries lurk behind every shadow. In this mesmerizing journey, 'Something Strange' serves as a guide through the darkest recesses of the imagination, where fear and fascination intertwine. Whether you're exploring haunted mansions or unraveling ancient secrets, let this haunting composition be your soundtrack to the unknown. Experience the dark and eerie allure of 'Something Strange' as it beckons you into a world where nothing is as it seems, and every sound whispers of something sinister lurking just beyond the edge of perception." #filmscore #synclicensing #horrorscore #suspence Black Irish Entertainment Film Scores | Something Strange https://lnkd.in/epq_D3Kr

I'm thrilled to share a project I created during my time at Emerson College, 'Her Song', a short film that brought a personal vision to life. Through this process, I gained valuable lessons that I continue to apply to my creative projects. Now, I invite you to watch and experience the emotional impact of 'Her Song' for yourself. Click the link below to see the film, and kindly share your thoughts - how did it make you feel, and what suggestions do you have for improvement? Your feedback is valuable in helping me grow as a creator! #HerSong #EmersonCollege #ShortFilm #CreativeProcess

When self-publishing authors are writing a stage play, they must consider the limitations of theatre. The larger the cast and the more settings a story has can limit which theatre companies have the resources for production. Playwrights should take a minimalist approach to their stage plays. Every character and setting should have a purpose. If it doesn‚Äôt, it should be removed. Learn more about writing a stage play at: https://lnkd.in/eE7vjgiu

#KillersOfTheFlowerMoon debuted as the most popular choice for both the US and UK audiences. The film saw a high of 69% of US moviegoers aged over 65 picking this title, vs 43% for the same audience in the UK. The infrequent audience accounted for the majority of the film‚Äôs audience, representing 68% of the UK audience and 62% of the US audience. Check out more #WeekendInsights here: https://lnkd.in/gTBUNz55 #Movio #Movies #MovieInsights #AudienceInsights

The Color Purple Movie Review The 2023 "bold new take" on The Color Purple was not all it was hyped up to be. If you are a big fan of musicals, then you'll love this one. However, I personally feel like musicals are a thing of the past. This movie could have benefitted from bold acting and strong emotions rather than music and dancing that sometimes felt forced or out of place. I will always appreciate the plot of the movie as it was created back in 1985, but this new version could have been executed better... not as a musical. What do you think? Are musicals in or out? Let me know in the comments below and be sure to like and subscribe to my YouTube channel! #StayReady #MovieReview
